Identification.ShortTitle: Coast Guard Radio Station Communications Charges Order, 1994
Identification.LongTitle: Order Prescribing Charges To Be Paid for Ship/Shore Communications Services Provided by Coast Guard Radio Stations

Provision.Text: The Minister of Transport, pursuant to paragraph 19(1)(b)* of the Financial Administration Act and Order in Council P.C. 1994-641 of April 21, 1994**, hereby makes the annexed Order prescribing charges to be paid for ship/shore communications services provided by Coast Guard Radio Stations, effective September 1, 1994.

Footnote.Text: SI/94-56, 1994 Canada Gazette Part II, p. 2030

Section.Text: This Order may be cited as the Coast Guard Radio Station Communications Charges Order, 1994.

Definition.Text: Coast Guard Radio Station means a shore-based radio station operated by the Canadian Coast Guard; (station radio de la Garde côtière)
originator, in the case of a communication transmitted to a ship, includes the landline company from which the communication was received by the Coast Guard Radio Station; (envoyeur)
owner, in respect of a ship, includes the operator of the ship. (propriétaire)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), this Order applies to every communication transmitted to a ship by means of a Coast Guard Radio Station or transmitted from a ship to a Coast Guard Radio Station.
This Order does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an AMVER report forwarded through a Coast Guard Radio Station; or

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of an aid to navigation, ice, ice routing, medical advice, pollution, weather, any navigational hazard or the safety of a life, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: addressed to a part of or a member of the Canadian Coast Guard that involves a report of a ship movement, position or condition.

Section.Text: The charge payable for transmitting a communication of the type set out in column I of an item of the schedule for the period of time or number of words set out in column II of that item is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as set out in column III of that item, where the communication

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is transmitted from or to a ship registered in or licensed by Canada, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as set out in column IV of that item, for any other communication.

Section.Text: A charge payable pursuant to section 4 shall be paid to the Receiver General for Canada by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the originator, where the communication is transmitted to a ship; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the owner of the ship, where the communication is transmitted from a ship.

Subsection.Text: Payment of a charge payable pursuant to paragraph 4(b) shall be made in United States dollars.
For the purpose of subsection (1), one United States dollar is equivalent to 2.5374 gold francs.
